options.option_text: Turn your wheels toward the edge of the road.
Turn your wheels away from the edge of the road.
Keep your wheels facing straight.

question_text: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:

options.option_text: Slow.
Stop.
Turn.

question_text: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

options.option_text: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.
Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots.

question_text: This white sign means you:

options.option_text: May turn left only on a green arrow.
May turn left on a green light when it is safe.
Must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

question_text: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:

options.option_text: Turn in that direction after slowing and checking for traffic.
Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.
Turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop.

question_text: When you see this yellow sign, you should:

options.option_text: Always stop at the crosswalk.
Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.
Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

question_text: This sign tells you that:

options.option_text: No turns are allowed on the road.
The road narrows ahead.
There is a series of curves ahead.

question_text: Which of the following statements is true?

options.option_text: Driving too slowly is not an unsafe practice.
Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.
The speed at which you drive a vehicle does not affect safety.

question_text: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:

options.option_text: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.
Assert your right-of-way by driving faster.
Always maintain your position.

question_text: At an intersection with a yield sign, you:

options.option_text: Must yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.
Must yield to vehicles only on your right.
Should slow down but never stop.

question_text: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is traveling at 70 mph. You may legally drive:

options.option_text: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic.
Between 65 mph and 70 mph.
No faster than 65 mph.

question_text: On a freeway, you should look farther ahead than you would on a city street:

options.option_text: In order to see potential hazards early.
Because it takes a quarter of a mile to stop your vehicle completely.
Because it helps you keep up with traffic.

question_text: A white painted curb indicates a:

options.option_text: Loading zone for freight or passengers.
Loading zone for passengers or mail only.
Loading zone for freight only.

question_text: If a vehicle is equipped with airbags:

options.option_text: Seat belts should still be worn.
Seat belts do not need to be worn.
Seat belts should be worn behind the back.

question_text: A person may legally ride in the back of a pickup truck when:

options.option_text: The sides of the pickup bed are at least 24 inches high.
The back of the pickup is covered with a camper shell.
In a secured seat and while using an approved safety belt.

question_text: A curb painted blue means parking is:

options.option_text: Allowed for no longer than 15 minutes.
Only allowed when picking up or dropping off passengers.
For disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

question_text: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:

options.option_text: Slow down because the lane ends ahead.
Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
Change lanes and maintain your current speed.

question_text: When using a roundabout, drivers should:

options.option_text: Stop in the middle of the roundabout.
Yield to traffic already in the roundabout.
Yield to entering traffic.

question_text: This white sign means:

options.option_text: The railroad crossing is controlled. Continue at your regular speed.
Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing if necessary.
Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.

question_text: Which of these statements is true about drinking alcohol and driving?

options.option_text: If you can walk in a straight line after drinking, it is safe to drive.
If you are under the legal blood alcohol concentration limit, your driving isn't impaired.
Alcohol affects judgement, which is needed to drive safely.

question_text: When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

options.option_text: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.
At the legal speed limit.
More slowly than the freeway traffic.

question_text: This road sign means:

options.option_text: Sharp turn to the right ahead.
Upcoming sharp left and right turns.
Winding road ahead.

question_text: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because:

options.option_text: Small vehicle drivers cannot adequately see large trucks and buses in their rearview mirrors.
Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.
Large trucks and buses travel at a higher speeds than small vehicles.

question_text: This sign means:

options.option_text: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
Slow-moving vehicle.
No U-turn.

question_text: Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:

options.option_text: Check your blind spots and mirrors.
Signal your intention before changing lanes.
All of the above.

question_text: If you are driving and you see animals standing near the roadway:

options.option_text: Speed up to scare them away.
Slow down and proceed with caution.
Quickly swerve into the next lane.

question_text: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should not:

options.option_text: Release your seat belt.
Brace yourself.
Press your head against the head restraint.

question_text: This sign means:

options.option_text: All traffic must turn left.
No left turn.
No U-turn.

question_text: This road sign means:

options.option_text: Bicycle crossing.
Stop only if other cars are approaching.
Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.

question_text: This road sign means:

options.option_text: No right turn.
No U-turns.
No left turn.

question_text: You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you should:

options.option_text: Wait for signal lights to stop flashing.
Look for a second train.
Both of the above.

question_text: When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle:

options.option_text: Helps you keep up with traffic.
Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.
Allows you to spot upcoming police officers.

question_text: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should:

options.option_text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.
Slow to the posted speed limit for the freeway.
Wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking.

question_text: When parking your vehicle on any hill:

options.option_text: One of your rear wheels should touch the curb.
Use your parking brake and leave the vehicle in "park."
Your front wheels should be parallel to the road, if there is no curb.

question_text: You see pedestrians near the road. You should:

options.option_text: Sound your horn and maintain your speed.
Speed up to clear the area quickly.
Slow down and pass with caution.

question_text: You must stop at the intersection ahead. Just before the intersection, you have to cross railroad tracks. You should stop before crossing the railroad tracks when:

options.option_text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.
The crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic.
You are transporting two or more children in a passenger vehicle.

question_text: If you parallel park facing downward on a hill:

options.option_text: Turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road.
Turn your wheels away from the side of the road.
Keep your wheels straight.

question_text: If you want to enter the freeway but you don't see a gap in traffic, you should:

options.option_text: Maintain your speed and force the other drivers to create a gap.
Slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap.
Stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap.

question_text: You want to make a right turn at the corner. A pedestrian with a guide dog is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you. Before making your right turn, you should:

options.option_text: Turn off your engine until the person crosses the street.
Tell the pedestrian when to cross the street.
Wait until the person crosses the street.

question_text: At an uncontrolled intersection where you cannot see cross traffic until you are just about to enter the intersection, the speed limit is:

options.option_text: 15 mph.
25 mph.
20 mph.

question_text: You should turn on your headlights:

options.option_text: One half hour after sunset.
When stopped at a railroad crossing.
When parked at a school.

question_text: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first?

options.option_text: Honk and step on the brake firmly.
Take your foot off the gas pedal.
Swerve into the lane next to you.

question_text: When a pedestrian guided by a dog or carrying a white cane is crossing the street:

options.option_text: You must always yield the right-of-way.
You must tell them where to cross the street.
You only have to yield the right-of-way if you are at a corner.

question_text: For which of the following traffic lights must you always stop your vehicle?

options.option_text: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and blacked out traffic signals.
Solid red lights, red arrows, and flashing yellow lights.
Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and yellow lights.

question_text: To make a right turn at a corner, you:

options.option_text: May not enter the bicycle lane.
Should only merge into the bicycle lane if you stop before turning.
Must merge into the bicycle lane before turning.

question_text: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog:

options.option_text: Only when the guide dog is leading the person across the street.
At all times.
Only if a crossing guard is present.

question_text: You are coming to an intersection with a flashing red light. You should:

options.option_text: Slow down and yield the right-of-way.
Slow down and drive carefully through the intersection.
Come to a complete stop, check the traffic, and go when it is safe to do so.

question_text: This road sign means:

options.option_text: Do not enter.
No parking.
No U-turn.

question_text: Placard abuse will result in:

options.option_text: Placard revocation only.
Only a fine.
Placard revocation, a fine, and/or jail time.

question_text: When can you drive in a bike lane?

options.option_text: During rush hour traffic if there are no bicyclists in the bike lane.
When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right.
When you want to pass a driver ahead of you who is turning right.

question_text: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to:

options.option_text: Oncoming vehicles also turning left.
All approaching vehicles.
Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a "Walk" signal.

question_text: When stopping on snow or ice, drivers who are operating vehicles equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) should:

options.option_text: Pump the brakes.
Press and hold the brake pedal firmly.
Stay off the brakes and wait for the car to drift to a stop.

question_text: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should:

options.option_text: Immediately enter the far-right traffic lane on the interstate and speed up to match the flow of traffic.
Use the shoulder of the main road to get up to the speed of traffic.
Speed up and enter the interstate only after you have identified a gap in traffic.

question_text: You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?

options.option_text: Straight ahead
Right, toward the side of the road
Left, toward the center of the road

question_text: You must notify the DMV within five days if you:

options.option_text: Are cited for a traffic violation.
Sell or transfer your vehicle.
Paint your vehicle a different color.

question_text: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when:

options.option_text: The collision causes $1,000 in damage.
You plan on being out of the state for more than 30 days.
You refinance the remaining balance of your vehicle loan.

question_text: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means:

options.option_text: The same thing as a yield sign.
The light is about to turn green.
The same thing as a stop sign.

question_text: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

options.option_text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.
Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.
Sport utility vehicles carrying four or more persons.

question_text: When a bicyclist is making a left turn:

options.option_text: They may use the left lane.
They may cut through all lanes.
They may wait on the side of the road.

question_text: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the:

options.option_text: Vehicle in front of you moves to the right to let you pass.
Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.
Yellow line next to the opposite side of the road is broken.

question_text: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

options.option_text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.
Five to 10 mph slower than the speed of traffic on the freeway.
The posted speed limit for freeway traffic.

question_text: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:

options.option_text: Make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
Cautiously drive around the pedestrian.
Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.

question_text: When approaching an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:

options.option_text: Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians, then proceed.
Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.
Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red.

question_text: While driving at night, a vehicle coming toward you has its high beams on, making it hard for you to see the road ahead. You should:

options.option_text: Look ahead toward the left edge of your lane.
Look ahead toward the right edge of your lane.
Look straight ahead in your lane.

question_text: Before stopping your vehicle at a traffic signal or sign, you should:

options.option_text: Press down hard on the accelerator.
Check your mirrors for surrounding traffic.
Set the parking brake.

question_text: You hit a parked vehicle and can't find the owner. What must you do?

options.option_text: Call your insurance company when you get home.
Wait for the owner to return.
Leave a note with your name and address on the parked vehicle.

question_text: What is the only medically proven method of removing alcohol or other drug combinations from your system?

options.option_text: Breathe in some fresh air.
Give your body time.
Drink coffee.

question_text: If the roadway is wet or icy, you should:

options.option_text: Reduce your speed.
Drive at the posted speed.
Speed up.

question_text: Stopping distances and the severity of collisions:

options.option_text: Decrease as a vehicle's speed increases.
Are not affected by a vehicle's speed.
Increase as a vehicle's speed increases.

question_text: This sign means:

options.option_text: Four-lane traffic ahead.
Divided highway ahead.
Two-way traffic ahead.

question_text: As you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light:

options.option_text: Stop before crossing the intersection.
Slow down and proceed with caution.
Wait for a green light before proceeding.

question_text: When you see a flashing yellow light at an intersection, you should:

options.option_text: Yield to all traffic before crossing the intersection.
Stop, then enter the intersection when it is safe to do so.
Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.

question_text: After you have passed a vehicle moving in the same direction, it is safe to move back into the right lane:

options.option_text: After about three seconds.
When you can no longer see the passed vehicle over your right shoulder.
When you can see the entire front of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

question_text: A sign with this shape means:

options.option_text: No passing zone.
Right turn permitted on red.
Yield right-of-way.

question_text: If a road is slippery, maintain a following distance that is:

options.option_text: No different than normal.
Farther from the car ahead than normal.
Closer to the car ahead than normal.

question_text: You are merging onto an interstate highway. You should:

options.option_text: Select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.
Merge across two lanes at once.
Always stop before entering the highway.

question_text: To be able to turn quickly, your hands must be:

options.option_text: On opposite sides of the steering wheel.
Next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.
On the top and bottom of the steering wheel.

question_text: Excessive speed:

options.option_text: Does not increase the chance of a crash.
Increases your ability to react to a hazard.
Often leads to high-risk decision-making.
